intro: Plettkea, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and enigmatic flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. The plant lacks leaves and instead absorbs nutrients through its roots, making it a mycoheterotroph, dependent on symbiotic relationships with fungi. Plettkea thrives in wet, acidic pine flatwoods and is often found growing on the trunks of trees.
